title: Introduction to Node.js
author: John Doe
content: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. It is designed to build scalable network applications.
excerpt: Node.js is a runtime that allows developers to build scalable applications with JavaScript.

title: Mastering Express.js
author: Jane Smith
content: Express.js is a fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js. It simplifies routing and middleware integration.
excerpt: Express.js is a web framework for Node.js that helps build robust APIs and web applications.

comments.comment: This helped me a lot in understanding Express.js.

title: Understanding MongoDB
author: Alice Cooper
content: MongoDB is a document-oriented NoSQL database that stores data in JSON-like format, making it more flexible and scalable.
excerpt: MongoDB allows developers to store unstructured data in the form of documents and collections.
